alert.note: Alert for Amite; Pike (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 3:22PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. Helena, northeastern Livingston, northeastern East Feliciana, northern Tangipahoa and west central Washington Parishes, southwestern Pike and southeastern Amite Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 322 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greensburg, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensburg, Amite, Amite City, Kentwood, Independence, Roseland, Montpelier, Darlington, Wilmer, Gillsburg, Easleyville, Natalbany, Tangipahoa and Tickfaw. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 34 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi near mile marker 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
